news.title: Why do some gamers invert their controls? Scientists now have answers, but theyâ€™re not what you think
news.summary: A majority of players push down on the controller to make their onscreen character look down, and up to make them look up. But there is a sizeable minority who do the opposite, controlling their avatars like a pilot controls a plane. For most modern games, this requires going into the settings and reconfiguring the default controls. Why do they still persist?
